Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a child, possibly Harpocrates. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Traces of a white coating and paint. Red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and sand inclusions. Head fragment, eroded.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Ptolemaic style and from a Ptolemaic context.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.044) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: MC#3 (Finds catalogue number)
